Topic

Work experience

Having some experience of work before you leave university has many benefits, more than you might first think. Not only can it help you gain genuine examples and evidence to support future applications and interviews, it can also help you make important decisions about what you do and don’t enjoy and what career you want to pursue.

  1. Step 1:

    1. Why work experience is important
    2. What employers and graduates say
    3. Understanding yourself and your goals

  2. Step 2:

    1. Placements
    2. Internships
    3. Part time and temporary work
    4. Unpaid work
    5. Less common work experience options
    6. Volunteering
    7. Volunteering overseas

  3. Step 3:

    1. Finding your own work experience opportunities
    2. On campus opportunities
    3. Using MyAvantage

  5. Step 5:

    1. Getting ready for work experience
    2. Developing employability during the experience
    3. Using work experience for career planning
